Package uk.ac.manchester.spinnaker.spalloc

Interface SpallocJobAPI

All Known Implementing Classes:
SpallocJob
public interface SpallocJobAPI
The interface supported by a spalloc job.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    default void destroy()
    Destroy the job and disconnect from the server.

    Destroy the job and disconnect from the server.

    java.lang.String getHostname()

    java.lang.String getMachineName()

    Reset (power-cycle) the boards allocated to the job.

    Turn the boards allocated to the job on or off.

    Block until the job's state changes from the supplied state.

    void waitUntilReady​(java.lang.Integer timeout)
    Block until the job is allocated and ready.
    BoardPhysicalCoordinates whereIs​(HasChipLocation chip)
    Locates and returns the physical coordinates containing a given chip in a machine allocated to this job.

  • Method Details

    • destroy

      default void destroy() throws java.io.IOException, SpallocServerException
      Destroy the job and disconnect from the server.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If communications fail.
      SpallocServerException - If the spalloc server rejects the operation request.

    • destroy

      void destroy​(java.lang.String reason) throws java.io.IOException, SpallocServerException
      Destroy the job and disconnect from the server.
      Parameters:
      reason - Gives a human-readable explanation for the destruction of the job.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If communications fail.
      SpallocServerException - If the spalloc server rejects the operation request.

    • setPower

      void setPower​(java.lang.Boolean powerOn) throws java.io.IOException, SpallocServerException
      Turn the boards allocated to the job on or off.

      Does nothing if the job has not yet been allocated any boards.

      The waitUntilReady(Integer) method may be used to wait for the boards to fully turn on or off.

      Parameters:
      powerOn - true to power on the boards, false to power off. If the boards are already turned on, setting power to true will reset them. If null, this method does nothing.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If communications fail.
      SpallocServerException - If the spalloc server rejects the operation request.

    • reset

      default void reset() throws java.io.IOException, SpallocServerException
      Reset (power-cycle) the boards allocated to the job.

      Does nothing if the job has not been allocated.

      The waitUntilReady(Integer) method may be used to wait for the boards to fully turn on or off.

      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If communications fail.
      SpallocServerException - If the spalloc server rejects the operation request.

    • getID

      int getID()
      Returns:
      The ID of the job.

    • getState

      State getState() throws java.io.IOException, SpallocServerException
      Returns:
      The current state of the job.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If communications fail.
      SpallocServerException - If the spalloc server rejects the operation request.

    • getPower

      java.lang.Boolean getPower() throws java.io.IOException, SpallocServerException
      Returns:
      The current power state of the job.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If communications fail.
      SpallocServerException - If the spalloc server rejects the operation request.

    • getDestroyReason

      java.lang.String getDestroyReason() throws java.io.IOException, SpallocServerException
      Returns:
      The reason for destruction of the job, or null if there is no reason (perhaps because the job isn't destroyed). Note that you should use getState() to determine if the job is destroyed, not this method.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If communications fail.
      SpallocServerException - If the spalloc server rejects the operation request.

    • getConnections

      java.util.List<Connection> getConnections() throws java.io.IOException, SpallocServerException, java.lang.IllegalStateException
      Returns:
      The list of connections, where each connection says what the hostname is to talk to a particular board's root chip.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If communications fail.
      SpallocServerException - If the spalloc server rejects the operation request.
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the spalloc job is not Ready.

    • getHostname

      java.lang.String getHostname() throws java.io.IOException, SpallocServerException
      Returns:
      The name of the host that is the root chip of the whole allocation.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If communications fail.
      SpallocServerException - If the spalloc server rejects the operation request.

    • getDimensions

      MachineDimensions getDimensions() throws java.io.IOException, SpallocServerException, java.lang.IllegalStateException
      Returns:
      The dimensions of the machine in chips, e.g., for booting.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If communications fail.
      SpallocServerException - If the spalloc server rejects the operation request.
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the spalloc job is not Ready.

    • getMachineName

      java.lang.String getMachineName() throws java.io.IOException, SpallocServerException, java.lang.IllegalStateException
      Returns:
      The name of the machine the job is allocated on.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If communications fail.
      SpallocServerException - If the spalloc server rejects the operation request.
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the spalloc job is not Ready.

    • getBoards

      java.util.List<BoardCoordinates> getBoards() throws java.io.IOException, SpallocServerException, java.lang.IllegalStateException
      Returns:
      All the boards allocated to the job.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If communications fail.
      SpallocServerException - If the spalloc server rejects the operation request.
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the spalloc job is not Ready.

    • waitForStateChange

      default State waitForStateChange​(State oldState) throws SpallocServerException
      Block until the job's state changes from the supplied state.
      Parameters:
      oldState - The current state.
      Returns:
      The new state.
      Throws:
      SpallocServerException - If the spalloc server rejects the operation request.

    • waitForStateChange

      State waitForStateChange​(State oldState, java.lang.Integer timeout) throws SpallocServerException
      Block until the job's state changes from the supplied state.
      Parameters:
      oldState - The current state.
      timeout - The number of seconds to wait for a change before timing out. If None, wait forever.
      Returns:
      The new state, or old state if timed out.
      Throws:
      SpallocServerException - If the spalloc server rejects the operation request.

    • waitUntilReady

      void waitUntilReady​(java.lang.Integer timeout) throws JobDestroyedException, java.io.IOException, SpallocServerException, SpallocStateChangeTimeoutException
      Block until the job is allocated and ready.
      Parameters:
      timeout - The number of milliseconds to wait before timing out. If None, wait forever.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If communications fail.
      SpallocServerException - If the spalloc server rejects the operation request.
      SpallocStateChangeTimeoutException - If the timeout expired before the ready state was entered.
      JobDestroyedException - If the job was destroyed before becoming ready.

    • whereIs

      BoardPhysicalCoordinates whereIs​(HasChipLocation chip) throws java.io.IOException, SpallocServerException
      Locates and returns the physical coordinates containing a given chip in a machine allocated to this job.
      Parameters:
      chip - The coordinates of the chip
      Returns:
      the physical coordinates of the board
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If communications fail.
      SpallocServerException - If the spalloc server rejects the operation request.
